rComments: Great prof. Really passionate about teaching which makes his lectures really engaging. Doesn't trick you when it comes to tests, just study the guide and you'll be good.

Dr. Samson is one of the best profs I have ever had. He is enthusiastic about lecture material and easy going. His tests and weekly quizzes are fair just come to class and do all the readings. Readings are easy to follow and pretty interesting. He also provided opportunities for extra credit which was nice! Happy to have taken this course!

Prof. Samson is one of the best profs I've had the pleasure to take a course with. His passion and genuine love for the course material is expressed in the lecture. Course material is fairly straightforward, tests are fair as long as you study for them. He provides clear instructions for the assignment. Definitely recommend taking ANT367.

Hands down the best Anthropology course I've taken, not because of the material taught in class but because of the lecturer. Dr Samson is an amazing lecturer, who has in depth knowledge of the information he teaches. He makes attendance mandatory with weekly quizzes, which is great, as it forces students to do the readings and show up to class.
teacherRatingTags: ['Participation matters', "Skip class? You won't pass.", 'Amazing lectures']

rComments: One of the best professors you'll come across at UTM. His lectures are interesting, and grading is fair. Tests are very easy if you attend all lectures, and he makes sure people don't skip class by having a quiz at the beginning of each class. Go to class and do the readings, and you'll end up with a 4.0.

He's a great professor and knows what he teaches. He genuinely cares about his students and wants them to succeed, hence shares a lot of study tips. He's also very good looking so his class never gets boring (content is pretty amazing too).

Dr Samson is the most amazing professor at UTM. He's extremely passionate about the subject matter, and tries his best to make class enjoyable for everyone. His lectures are more like Tedtalks. He doesn't read off of slides unlike other profs, but explains everything by relating to his own personal experiences as an anthropologist. Best prof ever!

Professor Samson is very passionate about his research and love for chimpanzees. His lectures are easy to follow and he keeps you very interested. In this class, there are a lot of opportunities to do well by following easy instructions for papers, reading articles for quizzes, and following his study guide. Respect him a lot and would take again!

Prof Samson is one of the most enthusiastic ant prof at UTM. when most prof just read PPT and make us memory every little detail, he focuses on engaging with the class. Tests are easy, just come to lecture you will be fine

One of the best profs ever! This class was not something I was particularly interested in but he made it so interesting. His lectures are really good and tests are all MC. There is no final exam and assignments are straight forward and easy marks! Loved it.

Professor Samson great. Yes there are readings to do for each class but they are definitely not dry what so ever and were very interesting. You can tell he's passionate about the subject matter and his students. Would 100% recommend.

He is the best prof I've had, you can tell he is actually passionate about what he is teaching and is making an effort to be interesting, which makes the lectures super fun. I felt like i Was in a 2 hour ted talk. The assignments & test are straightforward & he is clear with what he wants. ALso he is really funny and the best dressed prof at UTM :)

The assignments are super straight forward. MC questions on test are a bit tricky, but lemme tell ya, super cool guy, and really nice and approachable. You can tell he wants his students to do well and he often asks for feedback. He is also very well dressed and easy on the eyes ;)

Assignments are super straight forward. Gives very readings that are very relevant to the course material, they are helpful and not too long either! You can tell that he wants everyone to understand & do well, so he often asks for feedback, super cool guy. Very well dressed, he makes lectures more interesting with his good appearance ;)
